co.uk.genonline.simpleweb.web.gallery

Class ThumbnailManagerDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.uk.genonline.simpleweb.web.gallery.ThumbnailManagerDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ThumbnailManager

    public class ThumbnailManagerDefault
extends java.lang.Object
implements ThumbnailManager
    Class which handles the creation of a thumbnail folder and thumbnail files for galleries Includes following functionality: - Check existence of thumbnail folder and creates / recreates as appropriate - Checks whether thumbnails have changed since last time called (this will save time and resources to recreate every time) - Generates thumbnails for each file in the gallery, using supplied maximum height and width Created by thomassecondary on 18/04/15.

    • Method Detail

      • createThumbnailFolder

        public void createThumbnailFolder(java.io.File galleryRootFolder)
        Creates folder to hold the thumbnail images for a gallery. Conditions to deal with are: Case 1, File of same name as folder exists but isn't a folder: Abandon gallery (nothing we can do safely) Case 2, Folder doesn't exist: Create it. Case 3, Folder does exist: Do nothing
        Specified by:
        createThumbnailFolder in interface ThumbnailManager
        Parameters:
        galleryRootFolder - The full path of the gallery folder under which to create a thumbnail folder. NOTE: this is the specific folder for a specific gallery - not the root of all galleries (this has caused confusion!).

      • createAllThumbnails

        public boolean createAllThumbnails(java.io.File galleryRootFolder,
                          java.util.List<GalleryImage> imageList)
        Creates all the thumbnails from scratch from the list of images read from the image folder. Begins by deleting all thumbnails to ensure that they are up to date. This is necessary because as we have just created the gallery so can't check whether it has been modified since last time. There are potentially more intelligent ways of deleting the thumbnails to avoid a situation where we delete all the files and then run into an error which stops us re-creating them. For example we could just delete the file before re-creating it so we have the opportunity to abandon if we need to. This approach would potentially leave some old thumbnails lying around for images which have been deleted. For now take the blunt approach of deleting all the files in the folder and come back to it if we need to. Have taken a relaxed approach to error checking as it is unlikely that we would get this far into the code without having generated an error for null values etc. Hope this is right :-)
        Specified by:
        createAllThumbnails in interface ThumbnailManager
        Parameters:
        galleryRootFolder - The full path of the gallery folder under which to create the thumbnails.
        imageList -
        Returns:
        Returns false if there is an error creating creating the thumbnails or other error which stops thumbnails being generated.

      • deleteAllThumbnails

        public void deleteAllThumbnails(java.io.File galleryRootFolder)
        Description copied from interface: ThumbnailManager
        Takes the root folder for a gallery, works out where the thumbnails are and deletes them all. Note this method doesn't use a list of images to work from, it just deletes all images in the folder.
        Specified by:
        deleteAllThumbnails in interface ThumbnailManager
        Parameters:
        galleryRootFolder - The full path of the gallery folder under which to create the thumbnails.
